availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Pleasant Conway (Princeton, Kentucky, farmer and coroner)

body.p: Princeton, Kentucky, farmer and coroner. Virginia native. Married to Louisa A. Conway. Father of Mary B. Conway, Fidelia Caroline Conway, Francis A. Conway, William P. Conway, Henry J. Conway, and Albert B. Conway. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Princeton in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Princeton in 1860. Coroner for Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 377B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, District 2, p. 802.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 33.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 23.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 498A.
